titles.title: To amend title 5, United States Code, to extend the veterans' preference provisions of such title to individuals who served on active duty in the armed forces for a period of more than 180 consecutive days any part of which occurred after September 11, 2001, and before January 1, 2006, and separated from the armed forces under honorable conditions.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.

bill.summary: 5/5/2005--Introduced. Extends veterans' preference provisions to individuals who served on active duty in the Armed Forces for a period of more than 180 consecutive days any part of which occurred after September 11, 2001, and before January 1, 2006, and separated from the Armed Forces under honorable conditions.
